dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Janet Yellen as Treasury Secretary, that's a huge move from Biden.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Janet Yellen as Treasury Secretary, that's a huge move from Biden.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and if confirmed, she'd be the first woman ever in that role, which is pretty historic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and if confirmed, she'd be the first woman ever in that role, which is pretty historic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If she is nominated and confirmed by the Senate as Treasury Secretary, shell also be the first woman to serve in that role.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, plus she was already the first woman to lead the Fed. But honestly, her biggest challenge is gonna be the economic fallout from the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, plus she was already the first woman to lead the Fed. But honestly, her biggest challenge is gonna be the economic fallout from the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen was the first woman to lead the U.S. central bank and the first woman to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors. If she is nominated and confirmed, Yellen will be faced with the task of stabilizing an American economy that is reeling from the effects of the coronavirus pandemic amid ongoing gridlock over stimulus legislation in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. I mean, she's been pushing for more stimulus, right? She told Bloomberg last month that we need both monetary and fiscal support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. I mean, she's been pushing for more stimulus, right? She told Bloomberg last month that we need both monetary and fiscal support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes also pushed for additional stimulus measures during the coronavirus crisis, telling Bloomberg TV last month that we need support for the economy from both monetary and fiscal policy in addition to more effective public health measures to control the virus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And given the gridlock in Washington, she's gonna have to navigate that carefully. But she's seen as a middle-of-the-road pick, so maybe she can get some bipartisan support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And given the gridlock in Washington, she's gonna have to navigate that carefully. But she's seen as a middle-of-the-road pick, so maybe she can get some bipartisan support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If she is nominated and confirmed, Yellen will be faced with the task of stabilizing an American economy that is reeling from the effects of the coronavirus pandemic amid ongoing gridlock over stimulus legislation in Washington. Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Republicans might actually be okay with her since she's not viewed as a major threat to Wall Street, even though she supports Dodd-Frank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Republicans might actually be okay with her since she's not viewed as a major threat to Wall Street, even though she supports Dodd-Frank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen is a supporter of financial regulation, including the Dodd-Frank legislation introduced in 2010 to reform the banking system after the financial crisis, but she isnt viewed as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—Trump didn't reappoint her at the Fed, partly because, uh, some advisors said he thought she wasn't tall enough? Which is just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-Trump didn't reappoint her at the Fed, partly because, uh, some advisors said he thought she wasn't tall enough? Which is just wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Washington Post reported that year that Trumps advisors had encouraged him to choose his own appointee for the job, and that Trump had expressed concerns to aides that Yellen was not tall enough to run the U.S. central bank (she is 5 feet tall), the Post reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously? She's five feet tall, but like, that has nothing to do with running the central bank. Anyway, after the Fed she went to Brookings, so it's not like she faded away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously? She's five feet tall, but like, that has nothing to do with running the central bank. Anyway, after the Fed she went to Brookings, so it's not like she faded away.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Washington Post reported that year that Trumps advisors had encouraged him to choose his own appointee for the job, and that Trump had expressed concerns to aides that Yellen was not tall enough to run the U.S. central bank (she is 5 feet tall), the Post reported. Yellen went on to a role as a fellow at the Brookings Institution after her tenure at the Fed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Robert Reich seems pretty happy with the pick—he tweeted that she's not Elizabeth Warren but also not from Wall Street, which feels like a balanced take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Robert Reich seems pretty happy with the pick-he tweeted that she's not Elizabeth Warren but also not from Wall Street, which feels like a balanced take.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Reich, who served as Secretary of Labor in the Clinton administration, cheered Bidens pick. Shes not @SenWarren but shes not from the Street, he wrote on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it does. And Biden's really going for a lot of firsts with his appointments—first female DNI, first Latino DHS head…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it does. And Biden's really going for a lot of firsts with his appointments-first female D N I, first Latino D H S head...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday he announced his intention to nominate Avril Haines as the the first female Director of National Intelligence and Alejandro Mayorkas as the first Latino head of the Department of Homeland Security.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Avril Haines and Alejandro Mayorkas. It's a diverse team he's building, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Avril Haines and Alejandro Mayorkas. It's a diverse team he's building, for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday he announced his intention to nominate Avril Haines as the the first female Director of National Intelligence and Alejandro Mayorkas as the first Latino head of the Department of Homeland Security.
